ssms.controller.steering

Interface SteeringController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SteeringController_Base, SteeringController_FreeFlight, SteeringController_OrbitTarget

    public interface SteeringController
    This interface defines the contract for custom steering behaviour. The user can select which behaviours he wants to use in either first or second mode. A behaviour is qualified for the first mode if it supports all possible ship targets including none. This is because the first mode is also the fallback in case the second mode cannot handle the current ship target. An implementation is expected to use the annotations SteeringControllerOption_Label and SteeringControllerOption_AllowsEveryTarget.

    The implementation class must be added to the static list SSMSControllerModPlugin.registeredSteeringController during the ModPlugin.onApplicationLoad() call.

    If the steering controller has custom options they can be configured on the already existing controller mapping. During the ModPlugin.onApplicationLoad() call grab the default mapping and add the desired properties storing them in the mappings ControllerMapping.customProperties map.

    PropertiesContainerConfiguration<ControllerMapping> confControllerMapping = PropertiesContainerConfigurationFactory.getInstance().getOrCreatePropertiesContainerConfiguration("SSMSControllerMapping", ControllerMapping.class);
confControllerMapping.addProperty(new PropertyConfigurationInteger<>("MyMod.MyOption","[B] My Option","Does something with my steering controller.",null,1000,
    new PropertyValueGetter<ControllerMapping, Integer>() {
        @Override
        public Integer get(ControllerMapping sourceObject) {
            return (Integer)sourceObject.customProperties.get("MyMod.MyOption");
        }
    }, new PropertyValueSetter<ControllerMapping, Integer>() {
        @Override
        public void set(ControllerMapping sourceObject, Integer value) {
            if ( value == null ) sourceObject.customProperties.remove("MyMod.MyOption");
            else sourceObject.customProperties.put("MyMod.MyOption", value);
        }
    }, true, 0, 100));

    The steering controller can now evaluate the property by grabbing the mapping from the HandlerController.mapping and inspecting the ControllerMapping.customProperties map. The HandlerController.mapping can be null if no controller is in use.

    • Method Detail

      • activate

        boolean activate(com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.ShipAPI playerShip,
                 HandlerController controller,
                 com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.CombatEngineAPI engine)
        This method is immediately being called after an instance was created and before the steering controller is put into service. It hands off environment variables that stay constant for the existence of the controller.
        Parameters:
        playerShip - Ship that is being steered.
        controller - Controller that is being used as an input device for steering.
        engine - Combat engine that runs the current combat and provides access to all combat related objects.
        Returns:
        True if the activation succeeded.

      • onTargetSelected

        void onTargetSelected()
        Called whenever the user switches targets manually. The playerShip.getShipTarget() can change regardless of this call if the targeted ship got e.g. destroyed.

      • isTargetValid

        boolean isTargetValid()
        Returns:
        True if the playerShip.getShipTarget() is still supported by this steering controller.

      • steer

        void steer(float timeAdvanced,
           float offsetFacingAngle)
        This method applies the per frame steering to the playerShip. It is being called during the EveryFrameCombatPlugin.processInputPreCoreControls(...) and can send commands to the playerShip that will be executed in the current frame.
        Parameters:
        timeAdvanced - How much combat progressed, this can be zero.
        offsetFacingAngle - How much the ships front should be turned to allow e.g. broadside combat.

      • renderInWorldCoords

        void renderInWorldCoords(com.fs.starfarer.api.combat.ViewportAPI viewport,
                         float offsetFacingAngle)
        Allows rendering elements as part of the combat scene.
        Parameters:
        viewport - Rendering parameters.
        offsetFacingAngle - How much the ships front should be turned to allow e.g. broadside combat.

      • discard

        void discard()
        Called whenever a steering controller is put out of service. Any exterior references and cached data should be cleared to speed up garbage collection.
